mole can transform into a different form of cancer called gestational choriocarcinoma that can spread (metastasize) to other tissues such as the liver, lungs, or brain.",GHR,recurrent hydatidiform mole
How many people are affected by recurrent hydatidiform mole ?,"Hydatidiform moles occur in 1 in 600 to 1,000 pregnancies in western countries and are more common in developing countries. One to six percent of previously affected women will have a recurrent hydatidiform mole.",GHR,recurrent hydatid
